result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Patrick W. Polar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No possession of guns or any dangerous weapons.

Follow through with assessment, treatment or counseling by agent.  Complete mental health assessment and follow through.  Complete AODA.  

2 days jail credit. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Clerk Kimberly
Case Called: 11:38am
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig for ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendent appears with Atty James Koppelman

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

PLEA: 
Ct. 1- 2nd Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety-Use of dangerous weapon >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 2- Operate Firearm While Intoxicated >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 3- Carry Concealed Weapon >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: Ct. 1 >> COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 3 years for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to AMEND Ct. 1 to DC pursuant to 9.01 and $25.00 fine plus court costs.

Parties to set RH date on DEOJ with JA.
Bond continues

Ct. 2 & Ct. 3 with hold sentencing. Concurrent. Probabtion 3 years. Follow through with assesement, treatment, or counseling by agent. Complete mental health assessment and follow through. Complete AODA. No possession of guns or dangerous weapons. No contact with victim T.H. Pay court costs and DNA surcharge. 2 days jail credit.

Shall not consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action. No contact with T.H. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
